name: cnfrrnsmf
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0
body: -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c3, crest, cdm(c0)), ccn, c4)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, ctop))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c3, crest, cdm(c0)), ccn, c4)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csalgen, c3))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ Top)
⊣ c4 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈((c3[|`t]dom(c0))[Cn]c4))
⊣ c1 =(SalGen ` c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, ctop))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c3, crest, cdm(c0)), ccn, c4)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csalgen, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ Top)
⊣ c4 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈((c3[|`t]dom(c0))[Cn]c4))
⊣ c1 =(SalGen ` c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c3, ctop))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
-| wi(wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c3, ctop))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c3 ∈ Top)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ Fin)
⊣ (c2 ∈ Fin → c3 ∈ Top)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c3, crest, cdm(c0)), ccn, c4)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csalgen, c3))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
-| wi(wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c3, ctop))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
⊣ c4 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈((c3[|`t]dom(c0))[Cn]c4))
⊣ c1 =(SalGen ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ Fin)
⊣ (c2 ∈ Fin → c3 ∈ Top)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c3, ctop))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, cfv(crrx, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csmblfn, c1)))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c3, crest, cdm(c0)), ccn, c4)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csalgen, c3))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, cfv(crrx, c2)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(SMblFn ` c1))
⊣ c4 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈((c3[|`t]dom(c0))[Cn]c4))
⊣ c1 =(SalGen ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ Fin)
⊣ c3 =(TopOpen `(RR^ ` c2))

comment: A function, continuous from the standard topology on the space of n-dimensional reals to the standard topology on the reals, is Borel measurable. Proposition 121D (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 36 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
